English: Hmm? That top... Are you with Hudie?
Chinese:
嗯……？　那件上衣……
你是hudie的人嗎？
Korean:
응……? 그 겉옷……
너는 후디에 사람인가?
German: Hm? Das Oberteil ... Bist du von Hudie?

English:
I'm Kotaro. I sent you a case but never heard
back from you. Have you accepted it?
Chinese:
我是發出委託的光太郎。
雖然沒接到通知啦，但你接下了我的委託嗎？
Korean:
내가 의뢰를 낸 코타로야.
연락이 오진 않았지만 내 의뢰를 받아준 건가?
German:
Ich bin Kotaro. Ich habe euch einen Fall
geschickt, aber keine Antwort bekommen. Nehmt ihr
ihn an?

English:
You want to hear what I have to say before
deciding? What's the point? They're clearly evil!
Chinese:
要先聽狀況再決定要不要接？
還聽什麼狀況啊！　錯的是他們啊！
Korean:
이야기를 들어보고 의뢰를 받을지 결정하겠다고?
들어볼 것도 없잖아! 나쁜 건 그놈들이니까!
German:
Du willst dir anhören, was ich zu sagen habe,
bevor du dich entscheidest? Wozu? Die sind
eindeutig böse!

English:
Once you hear all about what they've been doing,
you'll want to destroy them just as much as I do.
Chinese:
要是你知道了黑市的惡形惡狀，
你一定也會想毀了他們的。
Korean:
암시장의 악행을 듣는다면 너 역시
그놈들을 박살 내고 싶어질걸
German:
Wenn du erst mal hörst, was die alles anstellen,
wirst du genauso erpicht darauf sein, sie zu
vernichten, wie ich.

English:
I'm sure you've heard about how badly Digimon are
treated on the black market.
Chinese:
你應該也有聽過吧？
黑市裡對待數碼寶貝的方法實在太過份了。
Korean:
너 역시 들은 적 있잖아.
암시장의 디지몬들은 너무 심한 취급을 받고 있어
German:
Bestimmt hast du davon gehört, wie schlecht
Digimon auf dem Schwarzmarkt behandelt werden.

English:
They keep them locked in tiny cages and don't give
them enough food.
Chinese:
他們把數碼寶貝擠進狹小的籠子裡，
連像樣的食物也不給他們。
Korean:
그놈들은 디지몬을 좁은 우리에 채워 넣고
제대로 된 밥도 주지 않아
German:
Sie werden in winzigen Käfigen gehalten und
werden nicht genug gefüttert.

English:
And when they run out of space, they dispose of
them without a second thought... Just delete them!
Chinese:
而且要是容量不夠了，
便毫不猶豫的廢棄……把他們刪除掉耶！？
Korean:
그런 주제에 너무 늘어나서 용량이 부족해지면
주저 없이 폐기…… 삭제해버린다고!?
German:
Und wenn kein Platz mehr ist, entsorgen sie die
Digimon, ohne mit der Wimper zu zucken ... Sie
löschen sie einfach!

English:
There are lots of hackers who see Digimon as
nothing more than computer programs, but they're
living things!
Chinese:
雖然有很多駭客認為他們不過是數碼寶貝，
只是程式而已……但他們也有生命啊！
Korean:
고작해야 디지몬, 고작해야 프로그램이라는 해커는
많지만…… 그 녀석들 역시 살아있어!
German:
Für viele Hacker sind Digimon nicht mehr als
Computerprogramme, aber es handelt sich um
Lebewesen!

English: It's disgusting, no matter how you look at it!
Chinese: 就算再怎麼樣，這也太可憐了吧！？
Korean: 아무리 그래도 너무 불쌍하잖아!?
German:
Das ist verachtenswert, wie man es auch dreht und
wendet!

English:
That's why I'm so desperate to save them! You have
to help me!
Chinese:
所以我想拯救他們！
幫我摧毀黑市吧！
Korean:
그러니 난 저 녀석들을 구해주고 싶어!
암시장을 없애는 걸 도와줘!
German:
Darum will ich sie unbedingt retten! Du musst
mir helfen!

English:
Or does Hudie support the market? Did you accept a
case from someone named Sosuke?
Chinese:
難道……你們接下了
黑市保留派的宗介的委託嗎？
Korean:
혹시… 너희들, 마켓 존속파인
소스케란 놈의 의뢰를 받았나?
German:
Oder unterstützt Hudie den Markt? Habt ihr einen
Fall von jemandem namens Sosuke angenommen?

English:
I saw his case on the bulletin board. Have you
sided with him?
Chinese:
我有看到他在委託布告欄上寫的喔，
難道你們想幫那種傢伙嗎？
Korean:
게시판에 써 있는 걸 봤어.
설마 그놈들을 편들 생각이냐?
German:
Ich habe seinen Fall an der Anschlagtafel gesehen.
Habt ihr euch auf seine Seite geschlagen?

English:
So you're still deciding. I guess you are in a
complicated position.
Chinese:
……考慮中啊。
也對，你們的立場會很複雜吧。
Korean:
…생각 중인가.
뭐, 너희들 입장에선 복잡한 문제겠지
German:
Dann denkt ihr also noch darüber nach. Ich
schätze, ihr seid in einer verzwickten
Lage.

English:
But think about it carefully. You wouldn't want to
be known for assisting criminals, would you?
Chinese:
但是，你要仔細想好喔。
你們也是有不幫助犯罪的規則吧？
Korean:
하지만 잘 생각해서 결정해줘.
너희는 일단 범죄에는 가담하지 않는다는 게 규칙이었지?
German:
Aber denk gründlich darüber nach. Ihr wollt doch
nicht in den Ruf geraten, Verbrecher zu
unterstützen, oder?

English: No! So help us save the Digimon!
Chinese: 那麼，也一起幫助數碼寶貝吧！
Korean: 그렇다면 디지몬을 같이 구해주자고!
German: Nein! Also helft uns, die Digimon zu retten!

English: We're doing it at noon tomorrow. We'll be waiting!
Chinese: 明天中午會採取行動。我會等你來喔！
Korean: 결행은 내일 낮이야. 난 기다릴 테니까!
German: Wir tun es morgen Mittag. Wir erwarten dich!

English: (I've heard from Kotaro. Now to hear from Sosuke.)
Chinese:
（聽完了光太郎的說法，
　接著去找宗介聽聽他的說法吧……）
Korean:
(코타로의 이야기를 들었다.
 다음엔 소스케의 이야기를 들으러 가자……)
German:
(Ich habe Kotaro angehört. Jetzt muss ich Sosuke
anhören.)

English:
(Although I don't know where he is either. I'll
ask Erika if he wrote his location on the bulletin
board...)
Chinese:
（……說起來，我也不知道宗介在哪裡。
　布告欄上也沒寫，問問艾莉卡吧）
Korean:
(……그러고 보니 소스케도 어디 있는지 모르네.
 게시판에 적혀 있었는지 에리카에게 물어보자)
German:
(Wobei ich auch nicht weiß, wo er ist. Ich werde
Erika fragen, ob er einen Treffpunkt an der
Anschlagtafel erwähnt hat.)

English: What's wrong?
Chinese: 怎麼啦？
Korean: 무슨 일이야?
German: Was ist los?

English: Sosuke's location?
Chinese: 宗介的位置？
Korean: 소스케의 위치?
German: Wo Sosuke ist?

English:
He forgot to write it on the BBS, but he just sent
an email. He's in the EDEN Free Area.
Chinese:
啊，他剛才發了一封信，說位置忘記寫在布告欄上了。
他在EDEN的「自由區域」喔。
Korean:
아아, 게시판에 적어두는 걸 잊었다고 방금 메일이 왔었어.
EDEN의「프리 에어리어」에 있대
German:
Er hat vergessen, es an der ATL anzugeben, aber er
hat gerade eine E-Mail geschickt. Er ist im
Freien Bereich in EDEN.

English: I told him you're on your way.
Chinese:
我會順便跟他說，你接下來會過去找他。
拜託你囉。
Korean:
덧붙여 네가 지금부터 이야기를 들으러 간다고 전해뒀으니
잘 부탁해
German: Ich habe ihm gesagt, dass du unterwegs bist.

English: (Time to meet Sosuke in the EDEN Free Area.)
Chinese: （去EDEN的自由區域跟宗介會面吧……）
Korean: (EDEN의 프리 에어리어에서 소스케와 합류하자……)
German:
(Jetzt muss ich mich mit Sosuke im Freien Bereich
von EDEN treffen.)
